text: LAN Airlines was a Chilean airline based in Santiago. It was the largest airline in Chile and it's Peruvian subsidiary was the largest airline in Peru. It was a member of the Oneworld alliance.http://www.oneworld.com/member- airlines/lan The name LAN is an acronym in Spanish for Línea Aérea Nacional, meaning National Airline. The airline took-over Brazil's TAM Airlines in 2012, forming the LATAM Airlines Group. Their seperate corporate identites merged in 2016 to create LATAM Airlines. ==References== Category:Airlines of Chile Category:Organisations based in Santiago, Chile Category:1920s establishments in Chile Category:1929 establishments in South America Category:20th-century establishments in Peru
title: LAN Airlines
